title: Oldřich Machala
text:
Oldřich Machala (born 4 August 1963) is a <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech</a> football coach and a former player. He is currently the manager of <a href="Czech%202.%20Liga">Czech 2. Liga</a> side <a href="1.%20HFK%20Olomouc">1. HFK Olomouc</a>.
Career.
Machala was born in <a href="Brunt%C3%A1l">Bruntál</a>. He played most of his <a href="Gambrinus%20liga">Gambrinus liga</a> career for <a href="SK%20Sigma%20Olomouc">SK Sigma Olomouc</a>, for which he earned 414 league caps, most in the club's history. He is considered a legendary footballer of the club. In 2000, he won the Personality of the League award at the <a href="Czech%20Footballer%20of%20the%20Year">Czech Footballer of the Year</a> awards. He won his only cap for the Czech Republic as a last-minute substitute against Nigeria in 1996.
Machala joined <a href="1.%20HFK%20Olomouc">1. HFK Olomouc</a> as manager in 2011 and led his team to the <a href="Moravian%E2%80%93Silesian%20Football%20League">Moravian–Silesian Football League</a> title and ensuing promotion to the <a href="Czech%202.%20Liga">Czech 2. Liga</a> in his first season with the club.
